clinical_study.brief_title: Study on Safety and Clinical Efficacy of AZVUDINE in Initial Stage COVID-19 Patients (SARS-CoV-2 Infected)
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of the Safety and Clinical Efficacy of AZVUDINE: Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Study in Mild Stage Patients Infected With the SARS-CoV-2 Virus

collaborator.agency: GALZU INSTITUTE OF RESEARCH, TEACHING, SCIENCE AND APPLIED TECHNOLOGY, Brazil
Clinical Research Unit / High Complexity Center (CRU/HCC) / Galzu Institute

brief_summary.textblock: Phase III, single-center, randomized, double-blind, parallel, placebo-controlled clinical study

detailed_description.textblock:
Hypothesis:
AZVUDINE has a therapeutic potential and safety profile for the treatment of patients infected with SARS-CoV-2.
Goals:
Main goal:
A. Consolidate scientific and technological cooperation between researchers from Brazil, China, and Russia (member countries of the BRICS), aiming to achieve world-class technical and scientific results on the theme of COVID-19.
B. To evaluate the effectiveness and safety of AZVUDINE tablets for the treatment of COVID-19, during the initial stage and mild symptoms, compared to conventional treatment [period: 14 days].
Specific objective:
To evaluate the clinical evolution of participants infected by SARS-CoV-2 treated with AZVUDINE (FNC) compared to placebo in the mild stage.
Statistical planning:
Statistical description: all statistical tests are performed by bilateral testing. A significance level of 5% will be adopted.
Baseline analysis: including subject distribution, data demographics, and baseline analysis.

primary_outcome.measure: Hospitalized patients proportion during the study
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of patients hospitalized during the study until Day 28, according to World Health Organization Ordinal Clinical Progression Scale (WHO, Jun/2020; scale 0 [asymptomatic] to 10 [death]), with score 4 to 7.

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants with clinical evolution of cure during the study
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to Day 15, Day 21 and Day 28 (approximately 14-30 days).
secondary_outcome.description: The clinical outcome of cure is defined in this protocol as the absence of viral RNA in the collected samples and clinical conditions for outpatient discharge
Improvement of clinical status in at least one category compared to screening on the Ordinal Clinical Improvement Scale (WHO, Jun/2020)

secondary_outcome.measure: Severity and duration of clinical symptoms
secondary_outcome.description: Severity and duration of fever, cough, fatigue or tiredness, high breathing, myalgia, nasal congestion or runny nose, sore throat, headache, chills, nausea, vomiting, anosmia, ageusia.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of renal function biochemical markers (serum creatinine and calculated glomerular filtration rate)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to Day 15, Day 21, Day 28, and Day 60.
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of change in biochemical markers of renal function in relation to the physiological reference intervals between the AZVUDINE and PLACEBO groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of liver function biochemical markers (AST/TGO, ALT/TGP, ALP, GGT, BIL total, and direct BIL)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to Day 15, Day 21, Day 28, and Day 60.
secondary_outcome.description: Rate of change in biochemical markers of hepatic function in relation to the physiological reference intervals between the AZVUDINA and PLACEBO groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of time to negative conversion of SARS-CoV-2 viral load by RT-PCR
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to Day 15, Day 21 and Day 28 (approximately 14-30 days).
secondary_outcome.description: Time (days) to negative conversion of the SARS-CoV-2 viral load between AZVUDINE (FNC) and placebo group

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the number of cycles for the detection of SARS-CoV-2 viral load by RT-PCR and application of the standard curve for calculating viral load.
secondary_outcome.description: SARS-CoV-2 viral load determination by standard-curve method of quantification.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analysis of the relationship between the calculated viral load and the clinical evolution of the participants in experimental (FNC) and PLACEBO groups.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 to Day 15, Day 21 and Day 28 (approximately 14-30 days).
secondary_outcome.description: Rating the relationship between viral load calculated and clinical outcomes of participants.
